lexUnit.name: team up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come together as a team to achieve a common goal

sentence.text: Silicon Graphics Inc , Mountain View , is not commenting on a report in the New York Times that it is considering teaming up with Time Warner Inc to develop hardware for interactive television .

Starstruck IBM Corp has teamed up with Boss Film Studios to devise software tools on IBM 's Power Visualisation System for key functions in the entertainment industry 's evolving all-digital film studio .
The school has teamed up with Assumption Grammar School from Ballynahinch to communicate with schools in Osaka and other cities in Japan .
The band will team up with producer Michael Brook when they start work on their new album in the New Year .

BellSouth Corp has teamed up with Wellfleet Communications Inc to market high-speed network systems and services to link multi-vendor local area networks over BellSouth 's Frame Relay and its Switched Multimegabit Data Services .
VIRGIN is teaming up with Blockbuster International to set up a chain of international mega-stores .
The two met at a rally and decided to team up for the Charrington RAC .
There was no happy return to the Hippy days when they teamed up for the Sixties hit I Got You Babe .
Jim Clark and Chapman teamed up in 1960 and one of the best relationships in Formula One Grand Prix racing soon developed .
Former Middlesbrough footballers Gary Pallister and Tony Mowbray teamed up in the Dave Bingham Memorial Trophy competition at Barnard Castle Golf Club .
ELTON JOHN and Axl Rose teamed up for a spectacular duet at the MTV awards in Los Angeles .
For this search I teamed up with two young friends , both experienced detector users , who had been searching a nearby farm and thus knew the area well .
In addition , Harland & Wolff has teamed up with the Japanese manufacturing giant Kawasaki , and so far has sent 60 people across to the Japanese yards to study their methods .

They are teaming up with British and American publishers for simultaneous English and German editions of the same book , or themselves issuing an increasing number of bilingual ( usually German/English ) books .
It could be that Navigation Mixte is teaming up to buy Paribas or that friendly defenders of Paribas such as Axa-Midi are strengthening their holdings .
A research institute has teamed up with a local college to offer joint degree courses .
Nippon DEC has also teamed up with four software companies to develop its software reseller business .
Here , several firms or research groups team up to obtain money from the department for one project .
A group of networking hardware vendors have teamed up to improve service and support for customers using multi-vendor networks .
Five of the women who sailed aboard Maiden have teamed up to put together a 60-footer .
At the end of my work placement , I teamed up with two other volunteers for a three week holiday .
A village landlord has teamed up with two jobfinding organisations to help his customers and neighbours find work .
Even Burt Lancaster became tired of Douglas 's temperament when they teamed up again in 1964 to make Seven Days in May .
CRYSTAL Palace unveil their new strike force today when Paul Williams and Chris Armstrong team up against Oldham at Selhurst Park .
